newsitem.title: UK: Three Brent cargoes kept ahead of deadline - trade.
newsitem.headline: Three Brent cargoes kept ahead of deadline - trade.

text.p: All three Brent cargoes due to turn wet on Tuesday were kept ahead of the five o'clock deadline, traders said.
Two cargoes loading Aug 20-22 were kept by British Petroleum while the third, an Aug 19-21 loader clocked to Texaco on Monday and deferred was kept by Wall Street trader J.Aron.
Brent cargoes are traded on a paper, or forward market until the 1700 London time deadline on the nearest trading day 15 days before their assigned loading date.
A trading company is clocked when it is left with a paper cargo which has turned physical after that deadline and therefore cannot be passed on as part of pre-sold paper cargo deals.
